item.title: Black: A Python Formatter to Brighten Your Workflow
item.description: Meet Black, a superb Python code formatter that will automatically reformat your code in accordance to PEP-8 standards.
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Lavoie

item.title: fzf - A Fuzzy Finder to Accomplish Anything
item.description: Search and, most importantly, finally find what you are looking for on your machine. If you rely on the terminal a lot, fzf may well be capable of speeding up your productivity!
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Lavoie

item.title: Suckless: Minimalist Tools That Work Great
item.description: I have been using a few different tools from suckless.org for a while and I must say that once everything is configured properly, they are a joy to use. Some tools, like dmenu and slock, seem simple on the surface, but they allow to simplify your workflow by quite a bit. Another one, st, is a truly fantastic and lightweight terminal!
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Lavoie

item.title: Exponentiation in Modular Arithmetic Made Easy
item.description: While playing around in the Python interpreter to validate answers to mathematical questions, I quickly found out that very large exponents are dealt with very inefficiently by default as they are simply evaluated as is. That’s where Python came to its own rescue.
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Lavoie

item.title: Tag Navigation in Vim
item.description: A quick introduction to tag navigation in Vim/Neovim.
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Lavoie

item.title: Dispose of Spam with Disposable Emails And More!
item.description: Have you ever received spam to your email address? Unless you are extremely lucky or are actually disconnected from the Internet and thus most probably not reading this, chances are you might have had an offer or two to receive gold from a Nigerian prince in the past. Before those princes and princesses generously start giving away their cryptocurrency in the near future in exchange for a trip to Western Union, get prepared and hide away your precious address!
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Lavoie

item.title: Have You Been Pwned?
item.description: Has your password been leaked in a major breach? You can find out thanks to Have I Been Pwned?… Or you can use their API and stop worrying about your password being sent through your Web browser!
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Lavoie

item.title: Number of Paths in a Grid… or in Life
item.description: Finding one’s way in life is not easy because there are so many paths we can take at any moment. Here is a way to look at it mathematically!
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Lavoie

item.title: Executing Shell Commands in a Python Script
item.description: Even for simple tasks, it is often worth basing one’s work on existing solutions when it is an appropriate option… And such can be the case when writing Python scripts!
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Lavoie

item.title: Binary to Decimal, Decimal to Binary Converter
item.description: As part of a course on the mathematics of Computer Science, I had to come up with algorithms to convert binary numbers to decimal numbers and vice versa.
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Lavoie

item.title: Surfing with qutebrowser — a Keyboard-Driven Web Browser
item.description: I recently started using this software as my main web browser and, as a Vim (Neovim) user, I must say I am finding the adventure quite compelling!
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Lavoie

item.title: Using Embedded Terminals Inside Neovim
item.description: Because every pixel counts, this neat trick will allow to use terminals inside Neovim and maximize the screen estate for a flawless integration with one of the best text editor available.

item.title: Using i3 as a Window Manager for Increased Productivity
item.description: I was striving to improve my productivity as one of my New Year’s resolutions and finally found the courage to take the time to try out i3, a fantastic window manager.
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Lavoie

item.title: Bash History Cleaner
item.description: If you ever wanted to automatically clean your Bash history file, here is a working solution written in Python that uses regular expressions to set any kind of pattern you might be looking for.
